Class Strings

java.lang.Object
com.tom.jpedit.gui.i18n.Strings
public final class Strings extends Object
Non-instantiable class for interacting with Internationalization (I18n). The class is used to load strings from a .properties file containing the strings for a language (found in the lang folder)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Strings.Content
    Contains the constants which represent the keys in the .properties file.

  • Field Details

    • locale

      public static Locale locale

  • Method Details

    • getLocale

      public static Locale getLocale()
      Returns the preferred locale of the user. It is the same as Locale.getDefault() unless the user has chosen a specific preferred locale in the settings menu.
      Returns:
      the user's preferred locale, or the default locale if none has been set.

    • loadStrings

      public static void loadStrings(@Nullable @Nullable Locale locale)
      Load the strings for a given locale from the lang folder. The string values are set as the text field of the enum constant whose name matches the key in the .properties file.
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale file to load strings from. If null, the default locale is used.

    • getFileStrings

      @NotNull public static @NotNull HashMap<Strings.Content,String> getFileStrings(@NotNull @NotNull Locale locale)
      Returns a HashMap containing the strings for a given locale. The key is the enum constant whose name matches the key in the .properties file, and the value is the string content found in the .properties file.
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale file to load strings from
      Returns:
      a HashMap containing the strings for a given locale

    • createTemplate

      public static void createTemplate(@NotNull @NotNull File path) throws IOException
      Create a blank .properties file for a given locale. The file is created at the path given.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to create the file at
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be created for any reason
